item.title: a pretty big deal
item.dc:creator: githens
item.description: There is a good chance I might by a Dell sometime this summer now that they are shipping systems with Ubuntu Linux and all the hardware configured. Despite that awesome news, the Ubuntu section of their website also fixes the problem with it being incredibly difficult to actually purchase things from their website. There are [...]
item.content:encoded:
There is a good chance I might by a Dell sometime this summer now that they are shipping systems with Ubuntu Linux and all the hardware configured.

Despite that awesome news, the Ubuntu section of their website also fixes the problem with it being incredibly difficult to actually purchase things from their website. There are 3 boxes (2 desktops and 1 laptop) that ship with Ubuntu and it’s pretty quick to select one and configure it, unlike the sprawling mess of models on the default Dell website. This has always been the highlight of using Apple’s Online Store, you can actually find a model and configure it.

Dell Ubuntu Models
They seem pretty reasonably priced too.
